required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality Control of Cardiopulmonary Exercise Equipment
clinical_study.official_title: Quality Control of P-CCMB Cardiopulmonary Exercise Equipment

lead_sponsor.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.source: National Institutes of Health Clinical Center (CC)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to make sure exercise equipment used by the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute is working properly. Healthy volunteers will be requested to use P-CCMB cardiopulmonary exercise equipment (treadmills and exercise bicycles) two times a month to ensure the machines are functioning properly.

detailed_description.textblock: Proper functioning of recently acquired P-CCMB cardiopulmonary exercise equipment will be verified by testing healthy volunteers. In addition, quality control will be verified by performing monthly testing of healthy volunteers as biologic standards.

criteria.textblock:
INCLUSION:
Healthy research volunteers who are between 21 and 65 years.
EXCLUSION:
Patients with a history of ischemic or valvular heart disease.
Patients with history of chronic pulmonary disease.
Pregnant women.

facility.name: National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

reference.citation: Sue DY, Wasserman K. Impact of integrative cardiopulmonary exercise testing on clinical decision making. Chest. 1991 Apr;99(4):981-92. Review.
Whipp BJ. The bioenergetic and gas exchange basis of exercise testing. Clin Chest Med. 1994 Jun;15(2):173-92. Review.
Wagner PD. Central and peripheral aspects of oxygen transport and adaptations with exercise. Sports Med. 1991 Mar;11(3):133-42. Review.
